revised_title: Condensation of Gases into Liquids: Experiments with Sulphurous Acid, Hydrogen Sulfide, Carbonic Acid, and Euchlorine
tldr: The author, Mr. Faraday, conducted experiments to condense various gases into liquids, including sulphurous acid, hydrogen sulfide, carbonic acid, and euchlorine. They observed the properties of these liquids, such as their refractive power, specific gravity, and pressure at different temperatures. The experiments also demonstrated the potential dangers of working with these substances, such as the powerful explosions that occurred when opening tubes containing carbonic acid.
